Wiki on Speed

A browser extension that makes your Wikipedia research more prodcutive.

Here's how it works:

About

Wiki on Speed is a browser extension that enhances the productivity of your research,
and improves your research efforts on Wikipedia.

When researching in Wikipedia, you often find yourself encountering many 'sub-subjects', loosely related to your main research subject. Usually you would need to open those subject's articles in a new tab and read through them. This extension allows you to read a sum-up of articles - see an excerpt of an article (including the article image), by hovering your mouse pointer over any inter-wiki link (link to a wiki article), without opening in a new tab. Thus maintaining your focus, allowing you to concentrate on the more relevant articles, and not disrupting your reading flow.

Features:

  • Unlimited number of wiki-hover boxes.
  • Recursion - you can see hover-boxes from wiki-links within another hover-box.
  • Supports all Wikipedia languages (including RTL).
  • Click anywhere to dismiss all open wiki-hover boxes
  •   Pin-down important hover boxes for later. Those won't be closed when you click on the background.
  •   If you still decide to open article in a new tab, you can do it from the hover-box.
  • Change settings, from the extension's options screen, inlcluding the hover-delay time before a box appears, turn on/off recursion and set multi-colors for the hover boxes,
    (The options screen is available from the browser's "extension manager"; In Chrome, write "
    chrome://extensions
    " in the address bar; in Firefox, write "
    about:addons
    ").
